definition: defense of the imperial palace or of the capital/the palace guard (or a member of that unit)
to guard/to protect/to defend/abbr. for 衛生|卫生, hygiene/health/abbr. for 衛生間|卫生间, toilet
surname Wei/vassal state during the Zhou Dynasty (1066-221 BC), located in present day Henan and Hebei Provinces

sentences.english: Palace guards' changing a rites is to be subjected to what visitor likes very much.
sentences.chinese: 禁卫军的换岗仪式是很受游人喜爱的。

sentences.english: He has been Colonel of the Welsh Guards since 1975.
sentences.chinese: 查尔斯于1975年开始担任威尔士禁卫军陆军上校。

sentences.english: The power of emperor's guard troopswastheorganic constitute of Chinese ancient regality.
sentences.chinese: 禁卫军权是中国古代专制君权的有机构成。

sentences.english: The platinum has Royal palace guards to stand guard before the temple.
sentences.chinese: 白金汉宫前有皇家禁卫军站岗。

sentences.english: The power of emperor's guard troops was the organic constitute of Chinese ancient autarchical regality .
sentences.chinese: 禁卫军权是中国古代专制君权的有机构成。

sentences.english: What early firearms were commonly used by the Janissaries?
sentences.chinese: 那么，土耳其苏丹禁卫军早期通常都用什么武器？

sentences.english: Qapukulu, 'court slaves', are household cavalry regiments loyal to the Sultan.
sentences.chinese: 宫廷卫队为土耳其禁卫骑兵，对苏丹无比忠诚。

sentences.english: The main role of the Tabardariyya is to guard the Sultan and the palace.
sentences.chinese: 苏丹禁卫军主要职责为保护苏丹王室及苏丹宫殿。

sentences.english: As praetorian prefect he is said to have had good judgement whenever he sought to act.
sentences.chinese: 身为禁卫军长官他在行动时有着良好的判断力。

definition: to guard/to protect/bodyguard (for officials in ancient times)
